titles.title: Senkaiden Houshin Engi
Romances of Sealed Gods
Soul Hunter - Battle of the Immortals!!
Soul Hunter - Senkaiden Hōshin Engi
SH
Soul Hunter
SHE
仙界伝 封神演義
Soul Hunter
Soul Hunter - Im Auftrag der Unsterblichen
Soul Hunter
Łowca Dusz
Soul Hunter
Soul Hunter

anime.description: The ancient Chinese Yin Dynasty is rotting from the inside out, infested with demon immortals. Project Soul Hunt was drafted by the Immortal High Council to capture all these `dangerous` souls and seal them away forever. Now all that remains is to find someone to carry it out. Why risk the life of a perfectly good immortal if you can send a good-for-nothing instead? http://anidb.net/ch90693 [Taikoubou] skips his lessons and naps while he is meditating; if he does not happen to make it back, so much the better. Armed with nothing but a magical rod and a hit list, Taikoubou is dragged off by the spiritual beast Sibuxiang. But when your job is killing demon immortals, on-the-job training can be extremely rough! Will Taikoubou get his act together in time to save his skin? Or will he and Sibu get vaporized his first day on the job?

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: immortality
tag.description: Immortality is the ability to live in a physical or spiritual form for an infinite or inconceivably vast length of time. Humans, whose life span is limited and who die of age, disease and external trauma, have long sought ways to extend their lives; the Epic of Gilgamesh, considered one of the first great literary works created by mankind, is primarily the quest of a hero seeking to become immortal. The advances of science, in particular medicine and engineering, and especially in the last few centuries, have helped people extend their life span and may yet continue finding ways to do so. In fiction, immortals are not quite as uncommon as in real life, and the possible implications of endless or very long lives are often explored. Such implications include, but are not limited to: repeatedly accompanying the deaths of those dear to them; having to hide their condition from the mortals surrounding them; becoming disillusioned with their lives and being unable to kill themselves; and even staying forever trapped in the body of a specific physical age, that body most often being that of a child. As such, while many may wish for immortality, it may be little more than a curse for the few who have it.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: talking animal
tag.description: Talking animals are a common theme in mythology and folk tales, as well as children`s literature. Fictional talking creatures often are anthropomorphic, possessing human-like qualities but appearing as a creature. An animal that only knows how to say its name (for example, 99.9% of all http://anidb.net/t2493 [Pokemon]), are not talking animals.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: floating island
tag.description: A floating island is an island either floating in the sky, or actually floating in the ocean (mobile). The island`s flotation can be powered either by magic or science.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: manipulation
tag.description: When someone else is pulling the strings.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: fight for peace
tag.description: Don`t they all... The protagonists are trying to ensure long-lasting peace by fighting a vicious enemy, hoping to defeat the threat permanently.

tag.name: strong male lead
tag.description: The lead male protagonist in this anime shows backbone, is competent, and does not shy away from seemingly insurmountable objectives.

tag.name: magical creatures
tag.description: Magical creatures are beings associated with a fantasy setting, thus do not exist in reality. Apparently they were "created of" or "powered by" magic. An incantation may have brought them into existence. Examples: A legendary creature, a mythological or folkloric creature, a fairy or demon, ...

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: magic weapons
tag.description: The characters in this anime wield magic weapons.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: Chinese mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Chinese mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient China.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Youzen
character.description: Youzen is A disciple at Konronsan. Actually, he is the son of the leader of Kingoutou, Tsuutenkyoushu and a youkai senin. He is a person of extreme confidence and takes great pride in his appearance. He has the ability to change into the body of any living thing, although his favorite transformation is that of Dakki. He is called the genius discipline.

episode.title: 太公望, 封神計画を授かる
Taikoubou is Accorded Project Soul Hunt
Taikun erhält seinen Auftrag
Taikun part en mission
Niezwykła misja
Taikoubou, Houshin Keikaku o Sazukaru
episode.summary: The Yin Dynasty is on the brink of destruction as Emperor Zhou is being manipulated by the demonic Dakki and her sisters. So, the Immortal High Council of Mount Kunlun have decided to send Taikoubou, an idiot doushi, and the magical beast Sibuxiang on Project Soul Hunt. Now, Taikoubou and Sibuxiang must "houshin" 365 souls. Along the way, Taikoubou and Sibu meet the Youkai Sennin, Shinkohyo, and his magical beast Kokutenko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 最初の封神す
Taikoubou Commits His First Houshin
Bauchschmerzen und Heldentaten
Le premier combat de Taikun
Taikoubou, Saisho no Houshin Su
episode.summary: Taikoubou and Sibuxiang arrive in Chouka, the capital city of the Yin Empire. There, Taikoubou gets so hungry that he ends up eating grass. As a result, he gets stomach pains and flies off with Sibu to find some medicine. The two then find themselves at a village, where they are fixing the roof of the home of a doctor, who gave Taikoubou medicine for his stomach. The village is then attacked by an army of the Yin. Taikoubou takes it upon himself to fight the leader of the army, Chinto. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 陳塘関に宝貝人間出現す
Paopei Human Appears in Chintou Outpost
Naza, der Android
L’apparition de Naza l’androïde
Chintoukan ni Paopei Ningen Shutsugen Su
episode.summary: Taikoubou and Sibu meet Nataku, the Paopei human. Taikoubou and Sibu get themselves in the middle of the dispute between Nataku and Lisei, Nataku`s father. Meanwhile, Dakki and Emperor Zhou hold a festival with each of the Four Lords. The party gets crashed when the Four Lords speak their minds, which leads to two of the Four Lords to be put to death. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 陳塘関の蓮桃大戦
Lotus-Peach War at Chintou Outpost
Ein neuer Weggefährte
Le combat de la pêche et du Lotus
Chintoukan no Hasumomo Taisen
episode.summary: Taikoubou tries to not only end the bad relationship between Nataku and Lisei, but also persuade Nataku into joining with him. Hakuyuko attempts to free his imprisoned father, Ki Shou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 西伯侯姫昌朝歌を脱出す
Ki Chou, Lord of the West, Escapes from Chouka
Flucht aus dem Palast
Chi Chan le seigneur de l’Ouest s’enfuit
Seihakukou Kishou Chouka o Dasshutsu Su
episode.summary: In the process of trying to liberate Ki Shou, Hakuyuko gets persecuted for attacking Dakki. Taikoubou returns to Mount Kunlun to talk to Genshitenson about the real purpose of Project Houshin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雷震子, 起風発雷す
Raishinshi Calls on Wind and Lightning
Mit Blitz und Donner
« Coup de Tonnerre » rugit
Raishinshi, Kifuuhatsurai Su
episode.summary: Taikoubou meets Raishinshi, a person with bat wings who claims to be a hero in the name of justice. Taikoubou aims to make an ally out of him, but Raishinshi is not going to be easy to persuade. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 楊戩に試される
Taikoubou is Tested by Youzen
Ein Meister der Verkleidung
Un nouveau défit pour Taikun
Taikoubou, Youzen ni Tamesareru
episode.summary: Taikoubou and his friends come face-to-face with Dakki. However, the Dakki they face turns out to be Youzen, a doushi from Mount Kunlun. He wishes to help Taikoubou, but Youzen wants to test him first. Kou Hiko rushes to the imperial palace before anything bad happens to his wife and sister. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 皇后姜妃, 逆賊として囚われる
Empress Ryouhi is Arrested as a Traitor
Machtkämpfe
L`Impératrice Chiang est arrêtée pour rébellion
Kougou Kyouhi, Gyakuzoku to Shite Torawareru
episode.summary: The duel between Taikoubou and Raishinshi begins. Empress Kyouhi, Zhou`s wife, is put under arrest because she has been accused of sending an assassin to kill Zhou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄飛虎, 造反を決意す
Kou Hiko Decides to Rise in Rebellion
Ein königlicher Tod
Le général Fun Faze décide de se révolter
Kou Hiko, Zouhan o Ketsui Su
episode.summary: Kou Hiko confronts Emperor Zhou and challenges him to a duel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 西伯侯姫昌と邂逅す
Taikoubou Encounters Ki Shou, Lord of the West
Reise in die westliche Provinz
Taikun rencontre le seigneur Chi Chan
Taikoubou, Seihakukou Kishou to Kaikou Su
episode.summary: The fight between Kou Hiko and Bunchu is stopped when Prince Yinxiao and Prince Yinhhong decide to be taken back to Chouka. However, Genshitenson has Hakutsuru Doji take them to Mount Kunlun. Taikoubou`s group have made it to Seiki Castle, but Taikoubou himself goes off on his own. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 西岐軍, 北へ出陣す
The Seiki Army Marches North
Die vier göttlichen Wächter
L’armée de l’Ouest avance vers le Nord
Seikigun, Kita e Shutsujin Su
episode.summary: Lord Ki Shou appoints Taikoubou as Seiki`s war minister, and just in time too. Bunchu`s special Sennin group, the Shisei, has come to destroy Seiki. Now, Taikoubou and his rag-tag team will have to stop the Shisei while Ki Shou and the Seiki army head to the North. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄飛虎, 聞仲, 街道に対決す
Kou Hiko and Bunchu Battle on the High Road
Kampf der Titanen
Le général Fun Faze contre Wenzon
Kou Hiko, Bunchuu, Kaidou ni Taiketsu Su
episode.summary: Bunchu blocks Taikoubou, Kou Hiko, the princes, and the rest of the gang from proceeding any further. Kou Hiko and Bunchu then fight one another. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 黄飛虎と出会う事
Taikoubou Meets Kou Hiko
Gefährliche Waffen
Taikun rencontre le Général Fun Faze
Taikoubou, Kou Hiko to Deau Koto
episode.summary: Two of Bunchu`s men, Chou Keihou and Fu Lin, use their Paopei to capture Kou Hiko, Kou Tenka, and the young Yin princes. It`s up to Taikoubou and his friends to save them! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 臨潼関に快男児あらわる
A Fine Fellow Appears at Rintou Outpost
Auf dem Weg in neue Welten
Un dur à cuire au barrage Lintow
Rintoukan ni Kaidanji Arawaru
episode.summary: Kou Hiko runs away with the princes to Rintou Outpost, but is soon hunted down by three assassins. Kou Tenka, the son of Kou Hiko, makes his appearance. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四聖封神
Hunting the Souls of Four Guardian-Deities
Ein knapper Sieg
La chasse des quatre divinités
Shisei Houshin
episode.summary: Taikoubou and his friends houshin the last two members of the Shisei, Koyuken and Ohma. Meanwhile, Ki Hatsu tries to get Su Kokuko and the North to join the West`s army in the upcoming rebellion against Emperor Zhou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 兄弟, 荒野に帰還す
The Brothers Return to the Wilderness
Das Mal des Todes
Le retour des princes
Kyoudai, Kouya ni Kikan Su
episode.summary: The two Yin princes, Yinxiao and Yinhong, return from their training on Mount Kunlun and show off their new Paopei. Prince Yinxiao tries to force the armies of the North and West into joining the Yin by placing seals on Taikoubou and his friends. Meanwhile, there is a creature wrecking havoc on the people in Chouka. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弦, 崇城に流るる事
The Melody of the Chinese Fiddle Drifts to Su Castle
Die Melodie der Vernunft
La viole de Chi Chan émeut l’ennemi
Gen, Suujou ni Nagaruru Koto
episode.summary: Taikoubou and his friends take a break to recover their wounds from their battle with the Shisei. They later catch up with Ki Shou, Kou Hiko, and Ki Hatsu, who are still trying to persuade Su Kokuko and the North to join Seiki`s forces. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四聖猛攻
The Shisei`s Fierce Attack
Göttliche Wächter, irdische Taktik
L’attaque des quatre divinités
Shisei Moukou
episode.summary: It`s Taikoubou and his friends vs. the Shisei! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 玉虚宮に進退極まる
Taikoubou is Cornered in Gyokukyo Palace
Eine schwierige Lage
Taikun est dans une situation désespérée
Taikoubou, Gyokukyokyuu ni Shintai Kiwamaru
episode.summary: Youzen reveals that he has only been monitoring Taikoubou all this time. Now, while Hakutsuru Doji (piloting the Hirai-i) takes on Taikoubou`s friends, Taikoubou himself must fight Youzen. Back on Earth, Kou Hiko stops some troops of the Yin Army from increasing tensions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 妲己封神
Dakki Is Houshined
Ein Reich ohne Herrscher
L’âme de Daji est capturée
Dakki Houshin
episode.summary: Emperor Zhou and Prince Yinhong are houshined. In one final attempt to houshin Dakki, Bunchu uses Dakki`s own Paopei, the Bankohan, against her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 元始天尊, 太公望に未来を見せる事
Genshitenson Shows Taikoubou the Future
Was die Zukunft bringt
Le grand Maître guide Taikun
Genshitenson, Taikoubou ni Mirai o Miseru Koto
episode.summary: Taikoubou and his friends get caught in Mount Kunlun`s defense system, making each person face their worst fears. Genshitenson appears before Taikoubou`s group and reveals the real truth behind the Houshin Project. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 崑崙山攻防戦
Battle at Mount Kunlun
Schlacht in den Kun-Lun Bergen
Bataille chez les immortels
Konronsan Koubousen
episode.summary: Dakki has been houshined, but her soul flies off to Mount Kunlun instead of the Houshin Platform. What is going on here? It seems that Genshitenson is hiding something, and Taikoubou and crew go to Mount Kunlun to ascertain the truth. However, they will have to get through Mount Kunlun`s defenses first. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 追憶の川に釣り針を降ろす事
Taikoubou Lowers a Fishing Hook Into the River of Reminiscence
Was die Vergangenheit brachte
Taikun réfléchit
Taikoubou, Tsuioku no Kawa ni Tsuribari o Orosu Koto
episode.summary: Taikoubou`s past is told. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 殷王朝滅亡す
The Yin Dynasty Falls
Dajis letzte Schlacht
La chute de la dynastie Yin
In Ouchou Metsubou Su
episode.summary: Although Oh Kijin and Kibi have been houshined, Dakki still remains. Also, it is revealed that the monster that Dakki created is actually... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太公望, 道を示す事
Taikoubou Shows the Way
Am Ende des Weges
Taikun montre le chemin
Taikoubou, Michi o Shimesu Koto
episode.summary: Dakki reappears at Mount Kunlun. It`s up to Taikoubou and his friends to stop her once and for all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 朝歌炎上
Chouka Goes Up In Flames
Die Hauptstadt brennt
La capitale en Flamme
Chouka Enjou
episode.summary: Taikoubou and company rush to Chouka to do battle with Dakki and her sisters. Glimpses of Emperor Zhou`s past are revealed. Source: crunchyroll
